title: Grandfather has prosthetic legs to match his DALMATIANS
text: Share this article Share ‘I was suffering very badly from circulation problems, caused by the diabetes, and it meant that the blood wasn’t circulating properly to extremities like my feet.’ The grandfather was fitted with NHS legs, but they were extremely uncomfortable. So he opted for the Dalmatian legs at the end of last year. 'They rubbed me where the leg had been amputated, so it was uncomfortable wearing them, so I wanted to get some new ones,' he said. Mr Sanderson had already adopted Poppy, a brown and white spotted Dalmatian and black and white spotted Harvey from a dog shelter, and he wanted to match in with them. His black and white spotted legs blend in perfectly with his canine friends Poppy and Harvey He said: ‘I was due to get new legs, and I knew that I could have them made with a pattern on, so I wanted one that would fit in with the dogs. ‘I love Dalmatians, and our two dogs are lovely mannered and really well behaved. They are great dogs, so I wanted to look the same as them.’ Mr Sanderson met Linda on a dating website ten years ago, and the pair regularly enjoy active sports such as rock climbing, scuba diving and canoeing together. He said: ‘Linda and I love doing outdoor sports together. She met me when I had prosthetic legs, but it has never held us back and we love doing all these sports together. I wear my prosthetic legs for 17 hours a day and it never bothers me.’ Mr Sanderson gets a double take from most people as he walks past with the dogs in tow. The grandfather was fitted with NHS legs, but they were extremely uncomfortable. So he opted for the Dalmatian legs at the end of last year He said: ‘People always do a double take when they see my legs. Sometimes they call out ‘nice legs’ to me as I go past. ‘Children love them as well. They love it if I’m walking the dogs - and I’ve got a dog either side of me, and then my two prosthetic legs in the middle. ‘The dogs are luckily really good on the lead and they don’t pull me over. I walk miles each day with them and I’m proud of my spotted legs. I think they look great too.’ Share or comment on this article 10
